definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)

sentences.english: The three major U. S. auto giant is the cash flow is drying up and in serious danger together.
sentences.chinese: 美国的三大汽车巨头是现金流枯竭而举步危艰。

sentences.english: Many years later, Susan became a difficult person.
sentences.chinese: 很多年之后，素心成了举步维艰的人。

sentences.english: And if the path you choose is too overgrown to make further progress.
sentences.chinese: 如果你选的路线荆棘丛生，难以举步。

sentences.english: Are you finding it hard to face life on your own?
sentences.chinese: 是否独自面对的生活让你觉得举步维艰？

sentences.english: Because of the lack of support for scientific research, Chinese medicines inch forward sluggishly.
sentences.chinese: 由于科研支援匮乏，中药产品的发展亦举步为艰。

sentences.english: Today we will look at the results of slogging through life under that extra weight.
sentences.chinese: 结果今天我们将看到在不必要的重负下生活举步维艰。

sentences.english: "Good-morning, " and he glittered when he walked.
sentences.chinese: 他的每一次举步都仿佛有阳光点缀。

sentences.english: From Santi's earthly tomb with demon's hole.
sentences.chinese: 你从桑蒂的土冢举步，那里有个魔鬼之窟。

sentences.english: Jung learned just how difficult in the fall of 2005.
sentences.chinese: 2005年秋季对彬娴来说，真可谓是举步维艰。

sentences.english: That made our life very hard.
sentences.chinese: 这使公司发展举步维艰。

sentences.english: Sir Alex Ferguson admits a glut of injuries has unsettled Manchester United this season.
sentences.chinese: 弗格森爵士承认伤兵满营让球队举步维艰。

sentences.english: The hotel has a superb location right on the sea front, with easy access to the beach.
sentences.chinese: 酒店位置绝佳，紧靠海边，举步便可达沙滩。

sentences.english: Aircraft production continued to plod along at an agonizingly slow pace.
sentences.chinese: 飞机制造业仍旧举步维艰，发展速度之缓很让人头疼。

sentences.english: The evidence shows that Europe continues to go in the right direction, however slow and hesitating that may be.
sentences.chinese: 证据表明欧洲继续步入正轨，不管如何的举步为艰。

sentences.english: But walk away from it he did, and into history.
sentences.chinese: 然而他从那里举步，走进了历史。

sentences.english: The force of reaction made change difficult.
sentences.chinese: 反动势力使得改革举步维艰。

definition: stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to come to a stand/to stop
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
